Violation_Type: Procedural error in refugee claim assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the applicant's refugee claim based on lack of subjective fear and credibility due to delay
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution based on Armenian ethnicity in Azerbaijan; cumulative incidents of discrimination and harassment alleged
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Court_Ruling: Case remanded to a differently constituted panel for redetermination
Defendant_Behavior: Board dismissed claim citing delay and inconsistent testimony
Legal_Standard: Delay is relevant but not decisive in assessing subjective fear; cumulative incidents may constitute persecution
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, delay in application, consistency of testimony
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate analysis of cumulative persecution and improper weighting of delay
Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies; court found inadequate reasoning
Evidence_Used: Testimony of applicant, documented incidents of discrimination and harassment
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96-98 of IRPA; jurisprudence on subjective fear and credibility
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to Armenian ethnicity in Azerbaijan
Evidence_Assessed: Alleged delay in filing, consistency of narrative, pattern of discriminatory treatment
Relief_Sought: Recognition as refugee, protection from removal
Governing_Rule: Under Canadian refugee law, delay is not determinative where credible fear and persecution are demonstrated
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to properly assess cumulative incidents of persecution
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution based on ethnic identity if returned to Azerbaijan
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to persecution based on Armenian ethnicity in Azerbaijan
Evidence_Handling: Board did not adequately analyze cumulative evidence of harassment and discrimination
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 97(1) of IRPA â€“ failure to consider all elements of a refugee claim
Evidence_Issues: Perceived inconsistencies in testimony and unexplained delay
Residency_Compliance: Applicant was in Canada and applied for refugee protection
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of context and pattern of discrimination
Decision_Rationale: Delay alone cannot undermine a credible claim supported by evidence of cumulative persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of thorough analysis of credibility and subjective fear despite plausible claims
Legal_Standard_Applied: Subjective fear assessed in light of objective evidence and context
